At Newbury, the feature race is the Group 3 Hackwood Stakes over six furlongs, which will feature some sprinters hoping for Group One success later in the year. Chief supporting races include the Aphrodite Stakes - transferred from Newmarket - the Rose Bowl Stakes for juveniles and also some competitive handicaps. The feature betting race of the day is at York, where a big field will go to post for the John Smith's Cup over 10 furlongs - a race won by some super horses in recent years. Analysis from Jason Weaver, reporting from Oli Bell and Matt Chapman and commentary from Richard Hoiles.(n)

programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their critics face-to-face. Hosts of Trecarne House in Cornwall Trish and Tom Brock-Morgan raise issues with Magna Carta's Dominic Read on his mark for their hosting, while he has a bone to pick with them over criticism of his five-star floating B&B. Stephen and Joanna of A Room with a View in Brighton receive complaints about their breakfast, and tensions run high as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Drive It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove set out to ride a lap on the most famous and dangerous bike race course of all, the Isle of Man TT. They have a 350cc Ducati that was actually raced at the TT in the '90s, but now needs refreshing and restoring before they can take it to some of the most iconic motorbike racing landmarks.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Pets with problems include a rare breed of bulldog called Cyrus, who has multiple issues, a lame husky named Ghost, and a Maltese-bichon frise cross suffering from seizures. Plus, Bucklersbury Bear, a huge Newfoundland, finds a new lease of life post-surgery - in the water.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: As Jonathan and Michael prepare their chateau for the big wedding, they have a sewage problem that threatens to take the whole first floor out of action; with 40 guests due, the timing couldn't be worse. Mandy and Steve's pool problems continue, and, with the first guests of the season about to arrive, they also have to contend with a collapsed wall. It's decision time for Philip and Angelina - can they find their own chateau to buy or is it time to return to Britain?(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Revisited
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Helen Gould and Phil Reddy five years after they built an earth-sheltered home in Cumbria. The presenter finds out if the house has survived without water leaking in and whether it has delivered the eco-friendly life the couple desired.(n)

programme.title: Code 37: Sex Crimes
programme.desc: Charles and Kevin talk to a woman found naked in her car in public, though it seems little more than an attention-seeking stunt. However, Greet insists that Hannah digs deep into the case, and the investigation leads to colleagues of the Ghent financial squad. Meanwhile, the sparks between Hannah and Koen begin to turn into a flame. Belgian crime thriller, starring Veerle Baetens and Gilles De Schryver. In Flemish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look at the specialist team dedicated to caring for people when they suffer the potentially devastating consequences of a stroke, including 77-year-old Alex. Husband Paul sits nervously at her bedside as they wait to see if the drug she has been given will bring back her speech and movement. Meanwhile, doctors examine 66-year-old Steven, who has been admitted with severe stomach cramps.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Two families come to terms with life-changing events, including the relatives of eight-year-old Junior, who has an open leg fracture and suspected internal bleeding after being knocked off his bike by a car. His mum Bekki reveals how Junior learned to cope with extraordinary setbacks and how she worries about his future because of health problems of her own. Meanwhile, 46-year-old Anthony arrives in A&E after suffering chest pains during a day out at the races. As doctors attempt to get to the bottom of what's causing his dangerously high heart rate, his wife discusses how Anthony's awareness of his mortality was increased by losing his father.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.sub-title: Lido, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the restaurants he tried to save, Lido, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro, to find out whether his advice has been put to good use.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A look at the specialist team dedicated to caring for people when they suffer the potentially devastating consequences of a stroke, including 77-year-old Alex. Husband Paul sits nervously at her bedside as they wait to see if the drug she has been given will bring back her speech and movement. Meanwhile, doctors examine 66-year-old Steven, who has been admitted with severe stomach cramps.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Two families come to terms with life-changing events, including the relatives of eight-year-old Junior, who has an open leg fracture and suspected internal bleeding after being knocked off his bike by a car. His mum Bekki reveals how Junior learned to cope with extraordinary setbacks and how she worries about his future because of health problems of her own. Meanwhile, 46-year-old Anthony arrives in A&E after suffering chest pains during a day out at the races. As doctors attempt to get to the bottom of what's causing his dangerously high heart rate, his wife discusses how Anthony's awareness of his mortality was increased by losing his father.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: Kicking Bishop Brennan Up the A*se
programme.desc: Cheating in the football match backfires on Ted, prompting his Rugged Island rivals to think up a devilish forfeit - and leaving the priest trying to contrive a way of kicking Bishop Brennan's backside and getting away with it. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A selection of previous investigations from the programme delving into the secrets behind mass-produced food. Jimmy Doherty heads to Kenya to find out what makes one tea more expensive than another, before meeting a taster for one of the UK's largest tea producers. Matt Tebbutt braves the icy waters of the North Sea to join divers harvesting scallops by hand from the sea bed, while Kate Quilton is in Israel to learn why some limes are much juicier than others.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: School cook Sandra Bracken looks to invest in the Spanish property market and is convinced the time is right to buy her dream holiday pad in Torrevieja on the Costa Blanca. Sara Damergi shows the potential buyer and her sister Susan a selection of options on the market for £45,000 or less.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps a Stockport couple with a budget of £113,000 search for a holiday apartment in their favourite town of Mijas in Spain. Joanne and Andy Green have spent their vacations there for more than a decade.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi shows Essex-born Jackie and her Portuguese partner Hilario a selection of properties that fall within their £62,000 budget in the Eastern Algarve, where the couple want to buy their dream holiday home.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for properties in south and east London. Sisters Ruth and Anna are pooling funds, while Aba, also a first-time buyer, confesses to champagne tastes, but lemonade money.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Liam Charles and Tom Allen host the quarter final of the baking contest, with the five best teams returning for their most gruelling challenges yet. In the first round, they teams must create 24 macarons and 24 cocktail-inspired desserts, in just three and a half hours. For the second round, they must combine sugar and chocolate work to create a spectacular showpiece that incorporates an edible game for judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden to play before they decide who is going through to the semi-final.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: NHS manager Helen Mather holds the first party in Leicester, hoping her plans for a simple menu will allow her more time to entertain her guests. However, the accident-prone host has a mishap involving raw pig's blood, and tries to turn the evening around with some 'urban ballet' after one diner sours the mood with a display of less-than-polite table manners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Terry Robinson hosts the second dinner party in Leicester with a 'Dress as Your Hero' theme, and the Elton John fan also decides to treat his guests to a song. He is confident his menu will score him top marks, but while Richard is blown away, Ryan remains unimpressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty spa manager Porchia Lee hosts the third dinner party in Leicester, serving up a French-themed menu of chicken liver pate, pan-fried chicken with tarragon sauce and creme brulee. Unfortunately for her the pudding is so bad her guests are reduced to tears, and double glazing salesman Richard Deeping insults her appearance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT enthusiast Ryan Bruce hosts the fourth dinner party in Leicester, and tries to impress his guests with a Spanish-inspired menu cooked in front of them. Entertainment is provided by Ryan's sister, West End actress Charlie Bruce, who puts the contestants through their paces in a salsa lesson.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Double-glazing salesman Richard Deeping hosts the final dinner party in Leicester, and hopes to make up for his boisterous behaviour by impressing the guests with his culinary prowess. In a bid to land higher scores, he puts on his own brand of entertainment, only to reveal a little too much of himself in the process, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Black Lion in Halland, East Sussex, where host Nigel Fright gets off to a shaky start when a kettle goes missing from one of the rooms. Later, he takes the guests to a salsa class, where Sherrill Tacy and Hayley Cotton are surprised by some of his dance moves.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Wheatsheaf Inn in Exning, near Newmarket, Suffolk, where guests are welcomed by owner Ken Clutterbuck and employee Ginny Trow. The proprietor tries to win his rivals round with his unique sense of humour, but tensions rise when the contestants go for a spin on a go-kart track.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sherrill Tacy hosts at the Sherwood Guesthouse in New Brighton on the Wirral, and is praised for the establishment's value for money. However, there is upset when her breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and her final review is far from perfect.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Final hosts Mark and Rachael Dann welcome the contestants to the Big Bear Lodge in Shropshire. They face the tough job of trying to keep the rift between some of the guests to a minimum in their ski-themed B&B, and their afternoon activity of canoeing raises a few laughs but accusations of cheating occur when the boys begin to get competitive.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: The Queen's Lost Family
programme.desc: Prince George makes a love match and marries the glamorous Princess Marina of Greece and Denmark, while Henry gives up the married Beryl Markham and also makes a suitable marriage. Edward, meanwhile, brings married American divorcee Wallis Simpson to George and Marina's pre-wedding party at Buckingham Palace, scandalising his parents. Not long after George V's Silver Jubilee celebrations, a unifying event for the nation, the King dies and Edward inherits the throne.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Greg, 47, is airlifted to St George's with critical injuries to his arm and leg after being knocked off his motorbike on the way into work. As his wife Lucie rushes to his bedside, she's shocked by what she finds. Cameras also follow, Cara, 11, who has fallen from the top of a human pyramid doing gymnastics and has a broken arm that doctors must try to realign.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient undergoing treatment for cancer develops a swelling in her throat that doctors fear may be a side-effect of the revolutionary new procedure she has been undergoing. Drastic steps have to be taken to save a patient with a dangerously high heart rate, and a seven-year-old boy is brought in after injuring his chest in a golf buggy accident.(n)

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Chatterbox Live
programme.desc: Stand-up show recorded at London's Bloomsbury Theatre in 2011, in which the comedienne shares humorous insights into her life, including the perils of living alone, and offers advice on such topics as non-fattening stress relief, the alternative to marriage and the acceptable face of adultery.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Johnny Vegas taking on guest captain Sarah Millican and Rob Beckett. Susie Dent presides in Dictionary Corner, ably assisted by Vic Reeves, and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Greg, 47, is airlifted to St George's with critical injuries to his arm and leg after being knocked off his motorbike on the way into work. As his wife Lucie rushes to his bedside, she's shocked by what she finds. Cameras also follow, Cara, 11, who has fallen from the top of a human pyramid doing gymnastics and has a broken arm that doctors must try to realign.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient undergoing treatment for cancer develops a swelling in her throat that doctors fear may be a side-effect of the revolutionary new procedure she has been undergoing. Drastic steps have to be taken to save a patient with a dangerously high heart rate, and a seven-year-old boy is brought in after injuring his chest in a golf buggy accident.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A selection of previous investigations from the programme delving into the secrets behind mass-produced food. Jimmy Doherty heads to Kenya to find out what makes one tea more expensive than another, before meeting a taster for one of the UK's largest tea producers. Matt Tebbutt braves the icy waters of the North Sea to join divers harvesting scallops by hand from the sea bed, while Kate Quilton is in Israel to learn why some limes are much juicier than others.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw take on a 1983 Citroen 2CV after its owner was unable to continue its restoration after being diagnosed with stage 4 throat cancer.(n)

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Lincoln to renovate a Ford Cortina GT. However, when they arrive at the lock-up garage where it is kept, they find the vehicle has seen much better days, and is now little more than a well-preserved body shell with numerous mechanical parts missing.(n)

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Cheshire to answer an SOS call about a 1938 MG TA, whose owner is unable to restore it due to illness.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Natasha Conti hosts the first dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and puts together an evening on the theme of a summer fete, complete with prizes for her fellow competitors. However, as the guests get to know each other, Chris Hiller finds himself in an awkward situation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm manager Sophie McConnell hopes that her pig-racing entertainment will impress the guests on her night as host in Salisbury, Wiltshire. She also plans to serve her home-raised cow Levi for the main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Brown-Hovelt hosts the third dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, and his menu includes Uzbekistani food and porridge ice-cream. The former army major dresses as an American sailor, but Natasha Conti does not find the outfit as appealing as she had hoped.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housing support officer Chris Hiller plans an eclectic but affordable menu for his night in Salisbury, Wiltshire, including chicken a l'orange and peppers stuffed with baked beans. However, with the sole focus being on keeping costs low, his efforts might not go down well with the other guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Care worker Jane Arnold hosts the final dinner party in Salisbury, Wiltshire, hoping to impress her guests with food from her local area. However, it is her bedroom revelations that catch the diners' attentions, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at One4 B&B in Cheltenham, where debonair art-dealing host Nick Purchase hopes to prove his that his establishment offers the best value for money. However, things get off to a less-than-ideal start when a life-drawing class leaves one of his guests in a fit of nervous giggles.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Windy Bottom B&B in Maidstone, Kent, where owners Gloria Barnett and Dave Goulding try to impress their guests with a trip to Leeds Castle. However, a proprietor manages to offend one of her rivals, and another is not impressed at being allocated a Versace-themed room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Jolly Carter pub in Bolton, Greater Manchester, run by Phil and Angie Sutcliffe. Despite a few nerves about the accommodation not measuring up, the room inspections go well, but the guests' verdict on the afternoon's roller disco remains to be seen.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: John Humberstone hosts at the 18-room Alexandra Hotel in Llandudno, where he hopes the scaffolding on the outside of his establishment will not ruin his chances. However, when one of the guests gets locked in a bathroom and there is a slip-up with towels and teabags, it seems he has plenty of other things to worry about.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured on the show reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Virginia Houslin opens the contest in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, and her hopes for some flirtatious fun are boosted by the arrival of her first guest, wedding singer Richard Wood. However the cheeky host faces a battle to win over the taste buds of her other diners as she tries to stake her claim for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business development manager Iyesha Atkins hosts the second dinner party in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, hoping her sophisticated event will win her the £1,000 prize. However, the evening does not go to plan when Virginia finds fault with Iyesha's main course, and the two women fall out following a discussion about religion.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding singer and confident cook Richard Wood hosts the third dinner party in Huddersfield. With steak on the menu, he opts not to listen to his guests' preferences and instead cooks and serves them his own way. However, with the starter a disaster and the rift between mum-of-three Virginia and ladette Iyesha deepening, Richard believes the only solution to save his night is for him to sing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tommy Mack hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, and tries to woo his guests with a Hollywood silent movie-themed evening, which includes a selection of mystery dishes and his very own style of rapping.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kim Connor hosts the final party in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, hoping her American diner-themed menu will delight her guests. Sweating over a hot stove is not what the glamorous hairdresser is used to, and she relies on helpful advice from her mother. The food fails to appeal to everyone's tastes, but Kim's after-dinner entertainment seems to revive her flagging chances of success.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In Maidstone, retired couple Bill and Jean Letley plan a highly contemporary bungalow complete with underfloor heating and prototype steel foundations. The project would test even the most accomplished workmen, but is left to their daughter and son-in-law, who have little building experience and have to make personal sacrifices.(n)

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.sub-title: 999: On the Front Line - Holiday Hell
programme.desc: Some of the cases paramedics are faced with when the holiday season is in full swing. In Nuneaton, the team is called to a 17-year-old who has been injured on a rugby pitch.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A woman is transferred to St George's after crashing her car into a tree, and has to have her broken ankle very quickly realigned if she is to have any hope of walking again. A man who collapsed suddenly is suspected of having a life-threatening head injury, while a four-year-old girl needs treatment after falling on an escalator.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This edition focuses on Northamptonshire police's tackling of hate crime, following PCs Lauren El Sharkawi and Nina Crehan after they investigate a call from a family in Northampton who have been subjected to racist abuse from a neighbour. The police are also experiencing a surge in homophobic and transphobic abuse and are called to deal with one incident where the victim being targeted is just 13.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Business
programme.desc: There is a surprise delivery for Hananya's chimps, a mystery illness strikes the orang-utan nursery at the Dorset ape rescue centre, and eating machine Charlie makes an appearance.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Business
programme.desc: Cathy the chimpanzee introduces her baby, and Hsiao-Quai shows that nothing will come between her and a meal.(n)

programme.title: RSPCA Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of RSPCA officers in Australia as they help animals in need.(n)

programme.title: RSPCA Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Following RSPCA workers in Australia, as officers help animals in need.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Barry and company are forced to tackle Gorilla Grodd, the latest snag in their attempt to scupper Reverse Flash. The ace up the man in yellow's sleeve provides the necessary diversion when our heroes follow the super simian into the sewers to prevent him wreaking havoc on the city. In the midst of all that chaos, Barry and Iris also find time for a heart-to-heart.(n)

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: When a new threat emerges in National City, Kara teams up with her cousin Superman to stop it, but the impromptu family reunion leaves Alex feeling a bit left out. The return of the comic-book adventure, starring Melissa Benoist, with Tyler Hoechlin as the Man of Steel.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Selma tells the family she is getting engaged to her prison pen-pal - none other than Sideshow Bob, who still harbours a grudge against Bart for landing him behind bars in the first place. Featuring the voice of Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart attends a rock concert with Milhouse, so Marge and Homer buy him a guitar to encourage his musical interests - but it is Otto who ends up calling the tune. Featuring the voices of Spinal Tap members Michael McKean and Christopher Guest.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam are left with pressing questions to answer as they investigate a number of unexplained deaths on the missing oil tanker used in Arkady's deal with Russia. They discover that the retired KGB officer had a personal connection to the ship. Crime drama, starring LL Cool J and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The case involving Arkady and his personal connection to the oil tanker leads Callen, Sam, Deeks and Kensi to Moscow, where the team must assume multiple undercover identities to locate the suspects. At the same time, Callen learns more about his father. Starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and Danno take time out with a fishing trip on the open sea, but their hopes of a relaxing break are thwarted when they spot a man in distress on a life raft. They drive over to help the guy out, but their good deed backfires spectacularly when he pulls a gun, hijacks their boat and leaves them stranded in the ocean on his dinghy. Alex O'Loughlin and Scott Caan star.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A polo player's chances of winning an upcoming match are severely reduced when he is decapitated riding his horse by a mystery assailant during a training session, leaving the Five-0 team with a particularly gory crime to solve. McGarrett enjoys a brief respite when his mother pays an unexpected visit, despite the fact she is still being targeted by Wo Fat. But as he soon realises, she is not the kind of woman to take orders from anyone. Alex O'Loughlin and Christine Lahti star.(n)

programme.title: Magnum P.I
programme.desc: As their wedding day approaches, Thomas and Higgins help a woman who stole illicit drugs inadvertently while thinking she was helping a school obtain much-needed supplies. Rick assists a retired soldier with the difficult task of re-entering the work force as a civilian.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: I Don't Know How She Does It
programme.desc: Claire manages to easily balance running Jay's closet business with her domestic tasks, but she might be exploiting a secret weapon. Meanwhile, Mitch and Cam are snubbed at their friends' wedding, leaving them to wonder what they might have done to deserve such rude treatment. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Lane.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A small lie spirals out of control for Phil when he tries to hide the fact he has an attractive new client from Claire, who is keeps her handsome yoga teacher. Elsewhere, Jay becomes obsessed with tracking down a troll who's been leaving nasty comments about his web show, and Mitch and Cam try to teach a nervous Lily to ride a bicycle.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge walks out on Homer for allowing an adult film to be shot in their house, and begins a new life - protecting endangered aquatic creatures alongside good-looking marine biologist Caleb Thorn. Featuring the guest voice of Alec Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The season comes to a close with a trio of wildlife documentaries reimagining the Planet Express crew as various creatures. First up are Fry and Leela as a pair of salmon whose hopes of love seem doomed when they realise they come from different streams. Then, Professor Hubert becomes a rare island tortoise named Lonesome Hubert who sets off on a 100-mile trek to find his perfect match, before a group of clown seals try to thwart a rebellion by their tyrannical alpha - who bears more than a passing resemblance to Bender.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Professor Farnsworth attempts to inject a little excitement into his life by souping up the Planet Express ship and entering a dangerous drag race. An unexpected detour, however, transports the gang to a mysterious two-dimensional universe.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse is dismayed to learn his estranged parents are considering a reconciliation and schemes to break them up again, helped by Bart and an idea borrowed from an episode of TV series The OC. Unfortunately, their devious scheme only succeeds in convincing Homer that Marge is having an affair.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa is so upset at Homer's failure to appreciate her lovingly crafted home-made Father's Day gift that she ends up going on a rampage through the school. Meanwhile, Bart is bullied into stealing a road sign.(n)

programme.title: Live MNF
programme.desc: Manchester United v Southampton (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the Premier League clash at Old Trafford. United have generally performed well since the restart as they look to qualify for next season's Champions League and will go into this match as favourites, but they were held to a 1-1 draw in August's reverse fixture at St Mary's Stadium. Daniel James gave the Red Devils an early lead on that occasion, but Jannik Vestergaard equalised in the second half and the Saints were able to hold on with 10 men after Kevin Danso's red card in the 73rd minute for a second bookable offence.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: An ex-soldier is forced into action when armed terrorists take control of a packed football stadium. Action drama, starring Dave Bautista, Pierce Brosnan and Ray Stevenson.(n)

programme.title: Condor
programme.desc: Deacon's traumatic past comes into focus, Sharla pursues Joubert and Mae makes a terrifying discovery.(n)

programme.title: Condor
programme.desc: Joe's morality faces the ultimate test as he tries to stop the plague from being released.(n)

programme.title: Karl Pilkington: The Moaning of Life
programme.desc: Karl aims to get to the bottom of his relative lack of a vocation, and visits an 85-year-old Japanese inventor to discover whether he has what it takes to become a genius. When the results prove less than encouraging, he sets his targets a little lower by trying his hand at becoming a traditional Japanese handyman. On the opposite end of the spectrum, he hangs out with a self-made millionaire in South Africa and jets off to Los Angeles to strut his stuff in a Hollywood fashion show.(n)

programme.title: Manifest
programme.desc: Season two ends in style as Michaela and Ben risk it all in a brave rescue attempt. The clock ticks down for Zeke. Supernatural drama, starring Melissa Roxburgh.(n)

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes.(n)

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Professor Farnsworth attempts to inject a little excitement into his life by souping up the Planet Express ship and entering a dangerous drag race. An unexpected detour, however, transports the gang to a mysterious two-dimensional universe.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Business
programme.desc: A serious turn of events affects Cathy and her newborn baby, while the apes at the rescue centre are treated to a selection of mouth-watering goodies. Chris Serle narrates.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Business
programme.desc: Featuring updates on the situation of chimpanzee Cathy and her baby, and the two nursery youngsters Ben and Pip.(n)

programme.title: RSPCA Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Following RSPCA workers in Australia, as officers help animals in need.(n)

programme.title: RSPCA Animal Rescue
programme.desc: A fruit bat infected with a potentially deadly virus is trapped in a family home.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Barry calls on some familiar faces after striking an uneasy alliance with former foe Captain Cold. Superhero adventure based on the DC Comics character, starring Grant Gustin as a CSI investigator who develops superhuman speed after being struck by lightning.(n)

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: Cadmus attacks National City with a kryptonite-powered villain who attempts to seriously hurt Supergirl, and Superman blames Hank because the kryptonite was stolen from the DEO. Comic-book adventure, starring Melissa Benoist.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouse falls in love with a new girl at school and begins to spend all his time with her, so, in a bid to get his friend back, Bart decides to tell her strict Catholic father about the relationship.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer comes up with the bright idea of making money by selling used grease, and ropes Bart in to help, while Lisa tries to join a popular new classmate's social clique. Featuring the guest voice of Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The return of the crime drama set in the high-stakes world of the Office of Special Projects. Callen goes rogue and embarks on a secret mission that leaves Sam and the team in the dark, with Hetty demanding the operation be shut down and that they intercept him before it's too late. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: DEA agent Talia Del Campo turns to the team for help after her partner is murdered, while Kensi grows suspicious that Deeks is hiding something, so he surprises her by introducing her to his mother.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Halloween presents the Five-0 team with a typically gory crime to solve - that of a nursing student who was kidnapped and cut to pieces while still alive. Initial evidence points to the black market in human organs, suggesting the killer wanted to sell hers to the highest bidder - but the autopsy reveals something much more sinister is afoot.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: I Ka Wa Mamue (In a Time Past)
programme.desc: Danno's search for the members of a terrorist cell leads to a terrifying life-or-death situation when he activates a suicide bomb rigged to explode at the slightest movement or touch. As technicians set to work to free the nervous cop, McGarrett tries to distract his friend and colleague by getting him to talk about the toughest case of his career, flashing back to Danno's days as a detective in New Jersey, when he and his partner Grace were held hostage by mobsters. Scott Caan and Alex O'Loughlin star, with Terrence Howard (Iron Man).(n)

programme.title: Magnum P.I
programme.desc: Thomas and Higgins find themselves on opposite sides when they are each hired separately by spouses in the middle of a contentious divorce.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron's emotional sister Pam proves too much for Mitchell when she comes to visit, while Phil and Claire struggle to stay awake during a spontaneous trip to Paris. Jay's bathroom remodeling project frustrates Gloria, and Andy has a wild night out in Las Vegas with Haley.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Gloria leave Luke and Manny on babysitting duties while they head off to a day at a spa, while Phil and Mitch go to the movies and Jay and Cam visit a sports bar. However, their days out are ruined when the fire alarm goes off back at the house and Claire suspects the boys are throwing a party.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Girl Who Slept Too Little
programme.desc: A construction project causes the local graveyard to be moved next to the family's home - to the dismay of Lisa, who is so concerned by the development she begins to suffer nightmares. She eventually decides the best way to conquer her fear is by facing it head on and spending a night at the cemetery.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Desperate to spend some time alone, Fry and Leela organise a romantic getaway to a tropical hotspot. However, she runs into her ex Sean and starts having doubts about her relationship with the one-time pizza delivery guy. Meanwhile, the rest of the crew heads to Simian 7, the Planet of the Apes.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: In a spoof of Steven Spielberg's ET: The Extra-Terrestrial, Fry gets left behind after he and his crew travel to a distant planet to search for herbal supplements, and is befriended by a young alien. But all the delivery boy really wants is to go home.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Last of the Red Hat Mamas
programme.desc: Marge joins a women's group, but soon discovers her fellow members plan to steal $1million from Mr Burns. Meanwhile, Lisa decides to spend the summer in Rome and hires a tutor to teach her Italian. Unfortunately, he turns out to be Milhouse.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: On an eventful tour of Italy in Mr Burns' new car, Homer, Marge and the kids encounter Sideshow Bob (guest star Kelsey Grammer), who begs them not to reveal his criminal past. Unfortunately for him, Lisa lets the cat out of the bag.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The body of a long-lost postman is found in a tree, with a mailbag containing a 40-year-old letter for Grandma Simpson. It reveals she had an affair around the time of Homer's conception, causing him to doubt whether Grampa is really his biological father. With the voices of Michael York, Joe Frazier and William H Macy.(n)

programme.title: Live Premier League
programme.desc: Chelsea v Norwich City (Kick-off 8.15pm). Coverage of the top-flight fixture, which takes place at Stamford Bridge.(n)

programme.title: The Hurricane Heist

programme.desc: Ross Kemp visits the Central American republic of Honduras, where he makes his way to the city of San Pedro Sula. With a rate of 169 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants last year - an average of more than three people each day - Sula has the dubious distinction of being the most dangerous city on the planet outside of a war zone. Ross discovers how armed drug gangs have taken over many parts of the country, forcing thousands to flee north on a freight train that transports migrants through Guatemala and across Mexico into the United States. But it's an arduous journey and not for the faint-hearted.
